template: In the diagram, lines AB and CD are parallel. If angle x = 65°, find angle y.
diagram: <svg width="380" height="250" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><line x1="30" y1="80" x2="350" y2="80" stroke="black" stroke-width="3"/><line x1="30" y1="170" x2="350" y2="170" stroke="black" stroke-width="3"/><line x1="159" y1="35" x2="243" y2="215" stroke="black" stroke-width="3"/><text x="20" y="75" font-size="18" font-weight="bold">A</text><text x="355" y="75" font-size="18" font-weight="bold">B</text><text x="20" y="165" font-size="18" font-weight="bold">C</text><text x="355" y="165" font-size="18" font-weight="bold">D</text><circle cx="180" cy="80" r="3" fill="black"/><circle cx="222" cy="170" r="3" fill="black"/><path d="M 205,80 A 25,25 0 0,1 191,103" fill="none" stroke="blue" stroke-width="2.5"/><text x="200" y="100" font-size="20" fill="blue" font-weight="bold">x</text><path d="M 211,147 A 25,25 0 0,1 247,170" fill="none" stroke="red" stroke-width="2.5"/><text x="248" y="165" font-size="20" fill="red" font-weight="bold">y</text><text x="210" y="50" font-size="16" fill="blue" font-weight="bold">x = 65°</text><text x="250" y="195" font-size="16" fill="red" font-weight="bold">y = ?</text></svg>

template: The diagram shows a rectangle with a triangle cut out. Find the area of the shaded region. (Rectangle: 12 cm × 8 cm, Triangle base: 6 cm, Triangle height: 4 cm)
diagram: <svg width="300" height="220" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><rect x="50" y="50" width="200" height="133.33" fill="#e3f2fd" stroke="black" stroke-width="2"/><polygon points="150,50 180,103.33 120,103.33" fill="white" stroke="black" stroke-width="2"/><text x="145" y="30" font-size="14" font-weight="bold">12 cm</text><text x="20" y="120" font-size="14" font-weight="bold">8 cm</text><text x="135" y="80" font-size="12" fill="red">6 cm</text><line x1="120" y1="103.33" x2="120" y2="50" stroke="red" stroke-width="1" stroke-dasharray="3,3"/><text x="95" y="80" font-size="12" fill="red">4 cm</text><line x1="50" y1="45" x2="250" y2="45" stroke="black" stroke-width="1" marker-start="url(#arrowhead)" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)"/><line x1="15" y1="50" x2="15" y2="183.33" stroke="black" stroke-width="1" marker-start="url(#arrowhead)" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)"/></svg>

template: The bar chart shows the number of books read by {CHARACTER_0}, {CHARACTER_1}, and {CHARACTER_2} in a month. How many more books did {CHARACTER_0} read than {CHARACTER_2}?
diagram: <svg width="350" height="250" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><line x1="50" y1="200" x2="320" y2="200" stroke="black" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="50" y1="200" x2="50" y2="50" stroke="black" stroke-width="2"/><rect x="70" y="80" width="60" height="120" fill="#4caf50"/><rect x="150" y="110" width="60" height="90" fill="#2196f3"/><rect x="230" y="140" width="60" height="60" fill="#ff9800"/><text x="85" y="220" font-size="14" font-weight="bold">{CHARACTER_0}</text><text x="160" y="220" font-size="14" font-weight="bold">{CHARACTER_1}</text><text x="245" y="220" font-size="14" font-weight="bold">{CHARACTER_2}</text><text x="85" y="75" font-size="14" font-weight="bold" fill="white">12</text><text x="170" y="105" font-size="14" font-weight="bold" fill="white">9</text><text x="250" y="135" font-size="14" font-weight="bold" fill="white">6</text><text x="15" y="205" font-size="12">0</text><text x="15" y="175" font-size="12">3</text><text x="15" y="145" font-size="12">6</text><text x="15" y="115" font-size="12">9</text><text x="10" y="85" font-size="12">12</text><text x="10" y="55" font-size="12">15</text><text x="120" y="240" font-size="14" font-weight="bold">Books Read</text><text x="10" y="30" font-size="12" font-weight="bold">Number</text></svg>

template: In the diagram, lines AB and CD are parallel. If angle x = 55°, find angle y. (Alternate angles)
diagram: <svg width="380" height="250" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><line x1="30" y1="80" x2="350" y2="80" stroke="black" stroke-width="3"/><line x1="30" y1="170" x2="350" y2="170" stroke="black" stroke-width="3"/><line x1="151" y1="39" x2="272" y2="211" stroke="black" stroke-width="3"/><text x="20" y="75" font-size="18" font-weight="bold">A</text><text x="355" y="75" font-size="18" font-weight="bold">B</text><text x="20" y="165" font-size="18" font-weight="bold">C</text><text x="355" y="165" font-size="18" font-weight="bold">D</text><circle cx="180" cy="80" r="3" fill="black"/><circle cx="243" cy="170" r="3" fill="black"/><path d="M 205,80 A 25,25 0 0,1 194,100" fill="none" stroke="blue" stroke-width="2.5"/><text x="200" y="98" font-size="20" fill="blue" font-weight="bold">x</text><path d="M 229,150 A 25,25 0 0,1 218,170" fill="none" stroke="red" stroke-width="2.5"/><text x="215" y="165" font-size="20" fill="red" font-weight="bold">y</text><text x="210" y="50" font-size="16" fill="blue" font-weight="bold">x = 55°</text><text x="250" y="145" font-size="16" fill="red" font-weight="bold">y = ?</text></svg>

template: In the diagram, lines AB and CD are parallel. If angle x = 72°, find angle y. (Corresponding angles)
diagram: <svg width="380" height="250" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><line x1="30" y1="80" x2="350" y2="80" stroke="black" stroke-width="3"/><line x1="30" y1="170" x2="350" y2="170" stroke="black" stroke-width="3"/><line x1="165" y1="32" x2="225" y2="218" stroke="black" stroke-width="3"/><text x="20" y="75" font-size="18" font-weight="bold">A</text><text x="355" y="75" font-size="18" font-weight="bold">B</text><text x="20" y="165" font-size="18" font-weight="bold">C</text><text x="355" y="165" font-size="18" font-weight="bold">D</text><circle cx="180" cy="80" r="3" fill="black"/><circle cx="209" cy="170" r="3" fill="black"/><path d="M 205,80 A 25,25 0 0,1 188,104" fill="none" stroke="blue" stroke-width="2.5"/><text x="200" y="102" font-size="20" fill="blue" font-weight="bold">x</text><path d="M 234,170 A 25,25 0 0,1 217,194" fill="none" stroke="red" stroke-width="2.5"/><text x="227" y="192" font-size="20" fill="red" font-weight="bold">y</text><text x="210" y="55" font-size="16" fill="blue" font-weight="bold">x = 72°</text><text x="240" y="150" font-size="16" fill="red" font-weight="bold">y = ?</text></svg>

template: In the diagram, two straight lines intersect. If angle x = 70°, find angle y. (Vertically opposite angles)
diagram: <svg width="380" height="250" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><line x1="149" y1="64" x2="251" y2="186" stroke="black" stroke-width="3"/><line x1="240" y1="56" x2="160" y2="194" stroke="black" stroke-width="3"/><circle cx="200" cy="125" r="3" fill="black"/><path d="M 216,144 A 25,25 0 0,1 188,147" fill="none" stroke="blue" stroke-width="2.5"/><text x="190" y="156" font-size="20" fill="blue" font-weight="bold">x</text><path d="M 184,106 A 25,25 0 0,0 212,103" fill="none" stroke="red" stroke-width="2.5"/><text x="208" y="96" font-size="20" fill="red" font-weight="bold">y</text><text x="220" y="155" font-size="16" fill="blue" font-weight="bold">x = 70°</text><text x="170" y="95" font-size="16" fill="red" font-weight="bold">y = ?</text></svg>

template: The bar chart shows the scores of three students in a test. What is the total score of all three students?
diagram: <svg width="350" height="250" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><line x1="50" y1="200" x2="320" y2="200" stroke="black" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="50" y1="200" x2="50" y2="50" stroke="black" stroke-width="2"/><rect x="70" y="90" width="60" height="110" fill="#e91e63"/><rect x="150" y="60" width="60" height="140" fill="#9c27b0"/><rect x="230" y="110" width="60" height="90" fill="#3f51b5"/><text x="75" y="220" font-size="14" font-weight="bold">Student A</text><text x="155" y="220" font-size="14" font-weight="bold">Student B</text><text x="235" y="220" font-size="14" font-weight="bold">Student C</text><text x="90" y="85" font-size="14" font-weight="bold" fill="white">55</text><text x="170" y="55" font-size="14" font-weight="bold" fill="white">70</text><text x="250" y="105" font-size="14" font-weight="bold" fill="white">45</text><text x="15" y="205" font-size="12">0</text><text x="10" y="185" font-size="12">10</text><text x="10" y="165" font-size="12">20</text><text x="10" y="145" font-size="12">30</text><text x="10" y="125" font-size="12">40</text><text x="10" y="105" font-size="12">50</text><text x="10" y="85" font-size="12">60</text><text x="10" y="65" font-size="12">70</text><text x="10" y="45" font-size="12">80</text><text x="135" y="240" font-size="14" font-weight="bold">Test Scores</text><text x="10" y="30" font-size="12" font-weight="bold">Score</text></svg>

template: The bar chart shows the number of cars sold by {CHARACTER_0} over 4 months. How many cars did {CHARACTER_0} sell in total?
diagram: <svg width="380" height="250" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><line x1="50" y1="200" x2="350" y2="200" stroke="black" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="50" y1="200" x2="50" y2="50" stroke="black" stroke-width="2"/><rect x="70" y="150" width="55" height="50" fill="#ff5722"/><rect x="140" y="130" width="55" height="70" fill="#ff9800"/><rect x="210" y="110" width="55" height="90" fill="#ffc107"/><rect x="280" y="120" width="55" height="80" fill="#ffeb3b"/><text x="82" y="220" font-size="14" font-weight="bold">Jan</text><text x="152" y="220" font-size="14" font-weight="bold">Feb</text><text x="222" y="220" font-size="14" font-weight="bold">Mar</text><text x="292" y="220" font-size="14" font-weight="bold">Apr</text><text x="85" y="145" font-size="14" font-weight="bold">5</text><text x="155" y="125" font-size="14" font-weight="bold">7</text><text x="225" y="105" font-size="14" font-weight="bold">9</text><text x="295" y="115" font-size="14" font-weight="bold">8</text><text x="15" y="205" font-size="12">0</text><text x="15" y="185" font-size="12">1</text><text x="15" y="165" font-size="12">3</text><text x="15" y="145" font-size="12">5</text><text x="15" y="125" font-size="12">7</text><text x="15" y="105" font-size="12">9</text><text x="10" y="85" font-size="12">11</text><text x="150" y="240" font-size="14" font-weight="bold">Cars Sold by {CHARACTER_0}</text><text x="5" y="30" font-size="12" font-weight="bold">Number</text></svg>

template: The bar chart shows the number of points scored by three teams. Team B scored how many more points than Team C?
diagram: <svg width="350" height="250" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><line x1="50" y1="200" x2="320" y2="200" stroke="black" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="50" y1="200" x2="50" y2="40" stroke="black" stroke-width="2"/><rect x="70" y="80" width="60" height="120" fill="#00bcd4"/><rect x="150" y="100" width="60" height="100" fill="#009688"/><rect x="230" y="140" width="60" height="60" fill="#4caf50"/><text x="80" y="220" font-size="14" font-weight="bold">Team A</text><text x="160" y="220" font-size="14" font-weight="bold">Team B</text><text x="240" y="220" font-size="14" font-weight="bold">Team C</text><text x="90" y="75" font-size="14" font-weight="bold" fill="white">60</text><text x="170" y="95" font-size="14" font-weight="bold" fill="white">50</text><text x="250" y="135" font-size="14" font-weight="bold" fill="white">30</text><text x="15" y="205" font-size="11">0</text><text x="10" y="185" font-size="11">10</text><text x="10" y="165" font-size="11">20</text><text x="10" y="145" font-size="11">30</text><text x="10" y="125" font-size="11">40</text><text x="10" y="105" font-size="11">50</text><text x="10" y="85" font-size="11">60</text><text x="10" y="65" font-size="11">70</text><text x="140" y="240" font-size="14" font-weight="bold">Points Scored</text><text x="5" y="30" font-size="12" font-weight="bold">Points</text></svg>

template: The bar chart shows the number of hours {CHARACTER_0}, {CHARACTER_1}, and {CHARACTER_2} spent studying in a week. What is the average number of hours they spent studying?
diagram: <svg width="350" height="250" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><line x1="50" y1="200" x2="320" y2="200" stroke="black" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="50" y1="200" x2="50" y2="50" stroke="black" stroke-width="2"/><rect x="70" y="100" width="60" height="100" fill="#673ab7"/><rect x="150" y="80" width="60" height="120" fill="#3f51b5"/><rect x="230" y="120" width="60" height="80" fill="#2196f3"/><text x="77" y="220" font-size="13" font-weight="bold">{CHARACTER_0}</text><text x="157" y="220" font-size="13" font-weight="bold">{CHARACTER_1}</text><text x="237" y="220" font-size="13" font-weight="bold">{CHARACTER_2}</text><text x="90" y="95" font-size="14" font-weight="bold" fill="white">10</text><text x="170" y="75" font-size="14" font-weight="bold" fill="white">12</text><text x="252" y="115" font-size="14" font-weight="bold" fill="white">8</text><text x="15" y="205" font-size="11">0</text><text x="15" y="185" font-size="11">2</text><text x="15" y="165" font-size="11">4</text><text x="15" y="145" font-size="11">6</text><text x="15" y="125" font-size="11">8</text><text x="10" y="105" font-size="11">10</text><text x="10" y="85" font-size="11">12</text><text x="10" y="65" font-size="11">14</text><text x="115" y="240" font-size="14" font-weight="bold">Study Hours Per Week</text><text x="10" y="30" font-size="12" font-weight="bold">Hours</text></svg>

template: {CHARACTER_0} bought 12 concert tickets at $45 each and sold them at $52 each. If {CHARACTER_0} gave $150 to {CHARACTER_1} from the profit, how much money does {CHARACTER_0} have left?
In a competition, {CHARACTER_0} scored 3/8 of total points, {CHARACTER_1} scored 2/5, and {CHARACTER_2} scored the rest. If {CHARACTER_2} scored 27 points, what was the total score?
{CHARACTER_0} invested $5000. After 1 year at 4% interest, {CHARACTER_0} reinvested everything for another year at 5%. How much money does {CHARACTER_0} have after 2 years?
The ratio of {CHARACTER_0}'s age to {CHARACTER_1}'s age is 4:3. In 6 years, the ratio will be 6:5. How old is {CHARACTER_0} now?

{CHARACTER_0} has collection of 240 items. 40% are cards, 1/4 are figures, and the rest are badges. {CHARACTER_0} gives 1/3 of the badges to {CHARACTER_1}. How many badges does {CHARACTER_0} have left?
{CHARACTER_0} ran 2.4km on Monday, 1.85km on Tuesday, and 3.2km on Wednesday. What is the average distance {CHARACTER_0} ran per day?
{CHARACTER_0} bought 8 items at $12.50 each and paid with five $50 notes. If the cashier gave back $150 in change, how much discount did {CHARACTER_0} receive in total?
{CHARACTER_0} started training at 6:45 AM and finished at 10:30 AM. If {CHARACTER_0} took two 15-minute breaks, how many minutes did {CHARACTER_0} actually train?
The average score of {CHARACTER_0}, {CHARACTER_1}, and {CHARACTER_2} in 5 tests is 82. If their total score in 4 tests is 312, what is their average in the 5th test?
{CHARACTER_0}, {CHARACTER_1}, and {CHARACTER_2} share prize money in ratio 5:3:2. If {CHARACTER_1} receives $450 more than {CHARACTER_2}, how much does {CHARACTER_0} receive?
{CHARACTER_0} saved $120 in January. In February, {CHARACTER_0} saved 25% more than January. In March, {CHARACTER_0} spent $85. How much money does {CHARACTER_0} have in total?
{CHARACTER_0} bought 6 books at $8.50 each and 4 pens at $2.25 each. If {CHARACTER_0} paid with three $50 notes, how much change did {CHARACTER_0} receive?
{CHARACTER_0} had a collection of cards. After giving 1/5 to {CHARACTER_1} and 1/4 of the remainder to {CHARACTER_2}, {CHARACTER_0} had 30 cards left. How many cards did {CHARACTER_0} have at first?
A shop increased prices by 20%, then gave a 15% discount on the new price. {CHARACTER_0} paid $102 for an item. What was the original price?
The ratio of {CHARACTER_0}'s savings to {CHARACTER_1}'s savings is 7:5. If {CHARACTER_0} has $420, how much more does {CHARACTER_0} have than {CHARACTER_1}?
A rectangular field is 45m long and 28m wide. {CHARACTER_0} runs around the perimeter twice. What distance does {CHARACTER_0} run?
{CHARACTER_0} has a square garden with side 12m. {CHARACTER_0} wants to put a fence around it. If fencing costs $15 per meter, how much will it cost?
{CHARACTER_0} started homework at 3:45 PM and finished at 6:20 PM, with a 25-minute break. How many minutes did {CHARACTER_0} actually work?
{CHARACTER_0} and {CHARACTER_1} start from the same point. {CHARACTER_0} walks at 60m/min north, {CHARACTER_1} walks at 80m/min south. After 15 minutes, how far apart are they?
{CHARACTER_0} filled 3/5 of a tank with water. After using 1/3 of the water, there were 40 liters left. What is the capacity of the tank?
A jar contains red and blue marbles in the ratio 3:2. {CHARACTER_0} adds 15 red marbles, making the ratio 2:1. How many blue marbles are there?
{CHARACTER_0} bought 2.5kg of apples at $3.60 per kg and 1.8kg of oranges at $4.20 per kg. What was the total cost?
{CHARACTER_0} shared $546 with {CHARACTER_1} and {CHARACTER_2} in ratio 4:3:2. How much did {CHARACTER_1} receive?
{CHARACTER_0} had some money. After spending 2/7 on books and $45 on games, {CHARACTER_0} had $80 left. How much money did {CHARACTER_0} have at first?
{CHARACTER_0} scored an average of 75 in 4 tests. If {CHARACTER_0} wants an average of 80 for 5 tests, what score is needed in the 5th test?
Initially, {CHARACTER_0} and {CHARACTER_1} had money in ratio 5:3. After {CHARACTER_0} gave $30 to {CHARACTER_1}, they had equal amounts. How much did {CHARACTER_0} have initially?
A box contains 180 chocolates. {CHARACTER_0} took 1/6, {CHARACTER_1} took 1/5 of the remainder, and {CHARACTER_2} took 20% of what was left. How many chocolates remain?
{CHARACTER_0} bought a bicycle for $450 and sold it at a loss of 20%. Then {CHARACTER_0} bought another bicycle for $500 and sold it at a profit of 25%. What was the total profit?
A tank is 2/3 full of water. After removing 40 liters, it is 1/2 full. What is the capacity of the tank?
{CHARACTER_0} invested $8000 at 5% interest per year. After 2 years, how much interest did {CHARACTER_0} earn?
{CHARACTER_0} saves $5 in week 1, $8 in week 2, $11 in week 3, following this pattern. How much does {CHARACTER_0} save in week 10?
The first term of a sequence is 7. Each subsequent term is 4 more than the previous. What is the 15th term?
A rectangular container is 20cm long, 15cm wide, and 10cm high. How many liters of water can it hold? (1 liter = 1000 cm³)
{CHARACTER_0} filled 5 bottles with 3.5 liters of juice each. If {CHARACTER_0} distributes equally to 7 people, how many liters does each person get?
The ratio of boys to girls in a class is 3:4. If there are 12 more girls than boys, how many students are in the class?
{CHARACTER_0}, {CHARACTER_1}, and {CHARACTER_2} shared $720 in ratio 5:4:3. {CHARACTER_0} spent 1/4 of the money. How much does {CHARACTER_0} have left?
A shop sold an item at $480 after a 20% discount and still made a 20% profit. What was the cost price?
{CHARACTER_0} bought items at $960. After selling 3/4 at 25% profit and the rest at 10% loss, what was the total profit?
A movie started at 7:35 PM and ended at 10:15 PM. If there was a 15-minute intermission, how long was the actual movie?
{CHARACTER_0} takes 45 minutes to complete homework, {CHARACTER_1} takes 1 hour 15 minutes. If they both start at 3:30 PM, what time will {CHARACTER_1} finish?
The average of 5 numbers is 48. Four of them are 42, 50, 45, and 53. What is the 5th number?
{CHARACTER_0} scored 78, 82, and 85 in 3 tests. What score is needed in the 4th test to have an average of 83?
A bag contains red and blue balls in ratio 2:3. After adding 10 red balls and removing 5 blue balls, the ratio becomes 3:2. How many red balls were there initially?
{CHARACTER_0} spent 3/8 of savings on a game console and 1/4 on games. If {CHARACTER_0} spent $450 in total, what were the initial savings?
A population of 8000 increased by 15% in year 1 and decreased by 10% in year 2. What is the population after 2 years?
The ratio of {CHARACTER_0}'s age to {CHARACTER_1}'s age is 5:7. In 8 years, their ages will sum to 76. How old is {CHARACTER_0} now?
{CHARACTER_0} bought 15 notebooks at $2.80 each and got a 10% discount. How much did {CHARACTER_0} pay?
A box contains 240 items. {CHARACTER_0} took 25%, {CHARACTER_1} took 1/3 of the remainder, and {CHARACTER_2} took the rest. How many items did {CHARACTER_2} get?
{CHARACTER_0} ran 3.8 km on Monday, 4.5 km on Tuesday, and 5.2 km on Wednesday. What is the average distance per day?
A rectangular room is 8.5m long and 6.4m wide. {CHARACTER_0} wants to carpet the floor. If carpet costs $25 per square meter, what is the total cost?
{CHARACTER_0} has a bag of 120 marbles. {CHARACTER_0} gives 1/4 to {CHARACTER_1} and 2/5 of the remainder to {CHARACTER_2}. How many marbles does {CHARACTER_0} have left?
{CHARACTER_0} travels 180 km in 2.5 hours. What is {CHARACTER_0}'s average speed in km/h?
A book costs $80 after a 20% discount. What was the original price?
{CHARACTER_0} and {CHARACTER_1} share $450 in the ratio 4:5. How much more does {CHARACTER_1} receive than {CHARACTER_0}?
{CHARACTER_0} bought 8 books at $12.50 each and 5 pens at $3.20 each. If {CHARACTER_0} paid with three $50 notes, how much change did {CHARACTER_0} receive?
A cube has a surface area of 96 cm². What is the volume of the cube?
{CHARACTER_0} bought 3.6 kg of apples at $4.50 per kg and 2.8 kg of oranges at $3.20 per kg. What is the total cost?
In a class of 40 students, 3/8 are boys. If 5 more boys join the class, what fraction of the class are boys now?
{CHARACTER_0} scored 78% on Test 1 and 85% on Test 2. If Test 1 is worth 40% of the final grade and Test 2 is worth 60%, what is {CHARACTER_0}'s final percentage?
{CHARACTER_0} runs at 8 km/h and {CHARACTER_1} runs at 6 km/h. They start from the same point and run in opposite directions. How far apart are they after 1.5 hours?
The ratio of {CHARACTER_0}'s savings to {CHARACTER_1}'s savings is 7:5. After {CHARACTER_0} spends $140, the ratio becomes 3:5. How much money does {CHARACTER_1} have?
{CHARACTER_0} has 480 trading cards. {CHARACTER_0} keeps 1/3, gives 3/8 to {CHARACTER_1}, and shares the rest equally between {CHARACTER_2} and {CHARACTER_3}. How many cards does {CHARACTER_2} get?
The average of 5 numbers is 48. If one number is removed, the average becomes 45. What was the removed number?
{CHARACTER_0} has some money. After spending 40% on a game and 25% of the remainder on snacks, {CHARACTER_0} has $90 left. How much money did {CHARACTER_0} have at first?
{CHARACTER_0} left home at 7:45 AM and arrived at school at 8:30 AM after walking 3 km. What was {CHARACTER_0}'s walking speed in m/min?
A water tank is 2.5 m long, 1.8 m wide, and 1.2 m high. If it is 3/4 filled with water, how many liters of water are in the tank?
{CHARACTER_0} read 2/5 of a book on Monday and 1/3 of the remaining pages on Tuesday. If there are 60 pages left to read, how many pages are in the book?
The cost of 1.25 kg of beef is $28.75. What is the cost of 3.6 kg of beef at the same price per kg?
{CHARACTER_0} cycles from Town A to Town B at 15 km/h and returns at 12 km/h. If the total journey takes 3 hours, what is the distance between the two towns?
A shop increased prices by 25% in January and decreased them by 20% in February. If an item now costs $120, what was its original price before January?
{CHARACTER_0} and {CHARACTER_1} had money in ratio 7:5. After {CHARACTER_0} spent $84 and {CHARACTER_1} spent $36, they had equal amounts. How much money did {CHARACTER_0} have at first?
The ratio of {CHARACTER_0}'s savings to {CHARACTER_1}'s savings was 3:4. After both saved an additional $120, the ratio became 5:6. How much did {CHARACTER_0} have at first?
{CHARACTER_0}, {CHARACTER_1}, and {CHARACTER_2} share stickers in ratio 2:3:5. If {CHARACTER_2} has 24 more stickers than {CHARACTER_0}, how many stickers does {CHARACTER_1} have?
The ratio of boys to girls in a class is 3:2. If 3 boys leave and 3 girls join, the ratio becomes 1:1. How many students were there originally?
{CHARACTER_0} and {CHARACTER_1} had stamps in ratio 5:3. {CHARACTER_0} gave 28 stamps to {CHARACTER_1} and now the ratio is 3:5. How many stamps did {CHARACTER_1} have at first?
{CHARACTER_0} spent 2/7 of money on books, 1/3 of remainder on food, and had $80 left. How much money did {CHARACTER_0} have at first?
{CHARACTER_0} read 3/8 of a book on Monday, 2/5 of the remaining pages on Tuesday, and 48 pages on Wednesday to finish. How many pages is the book?
{CHARACTER_0} had some marbles. After giving 1/4 to {CHARACTER_1}, 1/3 of remainder to {CHARACTER_2}, {CHARACTER_0} had 60 left. How many marbles at first?
{CHARACTER_0} spent 3/7 of savings on a game, then 2/3 of what was left on books. If {CHARACTER_0} has $24 left, how much was saved originally?
A tank was 5/8 full. After removing 45 liters, the remaining capacity became 1/4 full. What is the tank's full capacity in liters?
{CHARACTER_0} bought an item at 20% discount and sold it at 25% profit on the discounted price. If the profit was $60, what was the original price?
A shop increased prices by 20%, then decreased by 20%. If an item now costs $480, what was its original price?
{CHARACTER_0} scored 75% in Math and 80% in Science. If each test was worth 120 marks, what is the overall percentage?
{CHARACTER_0} invested $2000. In the first year it grew by 15%, in the second year it decreased by 10%. What is the final amount?
A store marks up items by 40% then offers 25% discount. If an item costs $315 after discount, what was the cost price?
{CHARACTER_0} runs at 8 km/h and {CHARACTER_1} cycles at 20 km/h. They start from same point in opposite directions. After how many minutes are they 21 km apart?
{CHARACTER_0} drives 180 km at 60 km/h, then another 240 km at 80 km/h. What is the average speed for the whole journey?
{CHARACTER_0} walks to school at 4 km/h and returns by bus at 20 km/h. If the total time is 2 hours, how far is the school?
{CHARACTER_0} and {CHARACTER_1} are 150 km apart. They drive towards each other at 50 km/h and 40 km/h. After how many hours do they meet?
{CHARACTER_0} runs 100 meters in 15 seconds. At this speed, how many kilometers can {CHARACTER_0} run in 30 minutes?
{CHARACTER_0} bought 15 items at $8 each. After selling 2/3 at $12 each and the rest at $10 each, what was the total profit?
{CHARACTER_0} has $500. After buying 3 books at $35 each and 4 pens at $8 each, how much money is left?
A rectangular garden is 24m long and 15m wide. If {CHARACTER_0} plants flowers in 2/3 of the area at $5 per square meter, how much is the total cost?
{CHARACTER_0} has 3 times as many cards as {CHARACTER_1}. After {CHARACTER_0} gives 12 to {CHARACTER_1}, {CHARACTER_0} has twice as many. How many cards does {CHARACTER_1} have now?
{CHARACTER_0} bought fruits: 5 apples at $2 each, 8 oranges at $1.50 each, and 3 mangoes at $4 each. If {CHARACTER_0} paid with two $50 notes, how much change?
{CHARACTER_0} scored an average of 78 in 4 tests. What must {CHARACTER_0} score in the 5th test to achieve an average of 80?
The average of 5 numbers is 32. If one number is removed, the average becomes 30. What was the removed number?
{CHARACTER_0} has average of 85 in 3 subjects. {CHARACTER_1} has average of 90 in 2 subjects. What is their combined average?
The average age of 6 children is 10 years. If a 7th child joins, the average becomes 11 years. What is the 7th child's age?
{CHARACTER_0} bought 4 items averaging $25 each and 6 items averaging $15 each. What is the average price of all 10 items?
A car travels at 72 km/h. What is its speed in m/s?
{CHARACTER_0} runs 2.4 km in 12 minutes. What is {CHARACTER_0}'s average speed in m/min?
A container can hold 3.5 litres of water. How many millilitres can it hold?
A rectangular field is 2.5 km long and 1800 m wide. What is the perimeter of the field in metres?
{CHARACTER_0} bought 2 kg 400 g of rice and 1.6 kg of sugar. What is the total mass in grams?
A pipe releases 750 ml of water per minute. How many litres of water will it release in 1 hour?
The distance from {CHARACTER_0}'s home to school is 1 km 350 m. {CHARACTER_0} walks this distance twice a day. What is the total distance {CHARACTER_0} walks in metres per day?
A train travels 180 km in 2 hours 30 minutes. What is the average speed of the train in km/h?
Which of the following nets can be folded to form a cube?
diagram: <svg width="400" height="180" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><g id="netA"><rect x="10" y="10" width="30" height="30" fill="white" stroke="black" stroke-width="2"/><rect x="40" y="10" width="30" height="30" fill="white" stroke="black" stroke-width="2"/><rect x="70" y="10" width="30" height="30" fill="white" stroke="black" stroke-width="2"/><rect x="100" y="10" width="30" height="30" fill="white" stroke="black" stroke-width="2"/><rect x="70" y="40" width="30" height="30" fill="white" stroke="black" stroke-width="2"/><rect x="70" y="70" width="30" height="30" fill="white" stroke="black" stroke-width="2"/><text x="35" y="135" font-size="14" font-weight="bold">Net A</text></g><g id="netB" transform="translate(150,0)"><rect x="10" y="10" width="30" height="30" fill="white" stroke="black" stroke-width="2"/><rect x="40" y="10" width="30" height="30" fill="white" stroke="black" stroke-width="2"/><rect x="70" y="10" width="30" height="30" fill="white" stroke="black" stroke-width="2"/><rect x="40" y="40" width="30" height="30" fill="white" stroke="black" stroke-width="2"/><rect x="40" y="70" width="30" height="30" fill="white" stroke="black" stroke-width="2"/><rect x="40" y="100" width="30" height="30" fill="white" stroke="black" stroke-width="2"/><text x="35" y="145" font-size="14" font-weight="bold">Net B</text></g></svg>
options: Both Net A and Net B
Neither Net A nor Net B
correct_answer: Both Net A and Net B
